main_definition: A special advantage, immunity or right granted to a particular person or group of people.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Unearned benefits based on social status or other factors
meanings_and_examples.example: Growing up in an affluent family provides many privileges, such as access to the best education.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The right to special treatment or exemption from certain rules or restrictions
meanings_and_examples.example: Due to his position, he has the privilege of bypassing long security lines at airports.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A recognized advantage enjoyed by a particular group due to their social status or other factors
meanings_and_examples.example: In some countries, white people have historically had privileges that were not afforded to others based on race.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An opportunity or favor granted out of kindness or generosity
meanings_and_examples.example: The privilege she offered to help with moving her furniture was greatly appreciated.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A special benefit, right, or exemption from rules that is not available to everyone
meanings_and_examples.example: As a senior citizen, he has the privilege of receiving discounts on public transportation.
